intro: Eranthemum detruncatum, commonly known as the dwarf eranthemum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, showy flowers. The plant typically produces small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Eranthemum detruncatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and prolonged blooming period.
